resources.string: Any additional tips\nfor using the build

8.5 -> Supply Depot
10.5 -> Barracks
12.5 -> Barracks
14 -> Supply Depot
18 -> Refinery, SCV Stop
20 -> Academy
After Academy -> 2 Medic, Stimpack, 2 Firebat
RUSH
Engineering Bay
Bio Attack Upgrade

After the rush, there are two choices. If you want to play a longer game, you can expand while going for the rush.\n\nIf you want to try to end the game, add an additional barracks and keep unit production.

8 -> Pylon
10 -> Gateway
11 -> Gas
13 -> Cybernetics Core
15 -> Pylon
16 -> Dragoon
20 -> Dragoon Range
21 -> Dragoon
24 -> Pylon
26 -> Dragoon
28 -> Nexus At Natural
29 -> Probe, Robotics Facility, Dragoon

After completing this build order, if you think the Terran is doing a 2 Factory early push, you should immediately build 2 more Gateways to counter this. Search timing should be around after you build the second Pylon.

8 -> Pylon
10 -> Gateway
12 -> Assimilator
13 -> Gateway, Zealot
15 -> Pylon
17 -> Cyborantics Core
19 -> Zealot
21 -> Pylon
22 -> Dragoon
24 -> Dragoon Range
25 -> Dragoon
27 -> Robotics Facility, Additional Gateway

This is probably one of the safest builds out there. It can stop almost any early game pressure such as DT or Reaver rush. However, this is not a very offensive build and thus you may be off to a bad start against opponents that go for an early Nexus.

8 -> Pylon
10 -> Gateway
11 -> Assimilator
13 -> Cyborantics Core
14 -> Zealot
16 -> Pylon
17 -> Citadel of Adun
18 -> Dragoon
21 -> Gateway, Templar Archive
22 -> Pylon
24 -> Dark Templar x 2
29 -> Pylon at Natural Expansion
30 -> Forge\After sending the DTs, Nexus at expo + Cannons if needed

With this build, it is possible to kill opponents that do not have detection. If the opponent does have detection, build the Nexus at natural, hide the Dark Templar and defend with cannons and High Templars.

8 -> Pylon
10 -> Gateway
11 -> Gas
13 -> Zealot
15 -> Pylon
17 -> Cybernetics Core
18 -> Zealot
22 -> Pylon, Dragoon
25 -> Dragoon Range
26 -> Dragoon
30 -> Robotics Facility
 -> Continue Probe/Dragoon Production ->
Observatory, Pylon, Robotics Support Bay, Pylon
After 5 Dragoons, 1 Reaver
~46 -> Nexus

Safe build, should be able to defend against anything, however it is not possible toput any kind of early pressure on the opponent since you are not getting a Shuttle to transport your Reaver. If your opponents expands quicker than you, you will be at a slight disadvantage but the game should be winnable with some harassment with Shuttle+Reaver, potentially Shuttle speed upgrade.

9 -> Supply Depot
12 -> Barracks, Refinery
14 -> Supply Depot, Scout
16 -> Factory, Marine
19 ~ 20 -> Factory
21 -> Supply Depot
100% Factory -> Factory Addon
100% Factory Addon -> Tank, Vulture Speed, 2nd Factory Addon
100% 2nd Factory Addon -> Mine Upgrade\Continue Vulture/Tank Production
%90 Mine Upgrade -> Rush with 2 SCVs and units

Block your entrance with Barracks/Supply Depot if you can, this build works a lot better as a surprise. This build is decent against any 1 Gateway Double Nexus build from Protoss. You may be able to do significant damage or end the game. If your rush gets blocked, build a Command Center at natural expansion and defend. Weak against early Dark Templars.

9 -> Supply Depot
11 -> Barracks, Refinery
13 -> SCV Scout
15 -> Start Marine Production
16 ->Factory, Supply Depot
Factory Addon -> Vulture Mine Upgrade -> Tank Production -> 6 Marine 1 Tank rush while producing Vulture

The goal of this build should be to put early game pressure on the enemy Protoss. When playing in Fighting Spirit, Your 6 Marines and 1 Tank should be out of your entrance by 4:30 game time. Micro intensive build.

9 -> Supply Depot
11 -> Barracks
12 -> SCV Scout
14 -> Supply Depot
19 -> Command Center at Expo
21 -> Refinery
23 -> Engineering Bay
25 -> Supply Depot
29 -> Bionic Weapons Upgrade
30 -> Academy
35 -> Barracks x 2
39 -> Barracks
40 -> Supply Deopt
41 -> Stim Pack
 42 -> 5th Barracks

This build is strong early to mid game because of its fast upgrade timings and expansion. You probably want to start building your factory and more tech at around ~65 supply. When all of the Zerg mutas have been killed off and you have a decent amount of bionic units, this is when you want to transition in to full mechanic (Tanks, Vultures, Goliaths, Vessles)
9 -> Overlord, Spawning Pool\n3 Drones\n11 -> Hatchery at Expo

8 -> Pylon
10 -> Gateway
11 -> Assimilator
13 -> Cybernatics Core
15 -> Pylon
17 -> Dragoon Range, Dragoon
21 -> Stop Probe Production, Nexus
21 -> Dragoon, Gateway
23 -> Pylon, Resume Probe Production
25 -> Dragoon x 2
31 -> Robotics Facility

This build is decent against any type of FD rush or early two factory timings due to fast production of dragoons from 2 Gateways, as well as being able to expand very early. However, there is nothing you can do about the Terran scouting your early expansion and thus they can immediately play a more macro oriented game without having to build an academy or an engineering bay to defend against Reavers or Dark Templars early on.

8 -> Pylon
10 -> Gateway
11 -> Assimilator
13 -> Cybernatics Core
15 -> Gateway, Stop Probe Production
15 -> Dragoon Range, Dragoon
17 -> Pylon
Continue Dragoon, Probe production

This build kills any type of early game pressure from the Terran due to a high number of dragoons early game, however, you NEED to do some kind of damage to the Terran early on since your expansion is going to be very slow. This build is good to use in combination of a proxy (Hidden, somewhere near opponent base) Robotics Facility Shuttle, Reaver.
